Physical Exam: Inspection of the chest and left arm
Justification: To assess for any visible signs of trauma, swelling, or deformity that may indicate an underlying issue.

Physical Exam: Palpation of the left arm and shoulder
Justification: To evaluate for tenderness, swelling, or any abnormal masses that could indicate musculoskeletal injury or other pathology.
To check for any abnormal heart sounds, murmurs, or signs of ischemia that may suggest cardiac involvement.
To rule out any respiratory issues that may be contributing to the shortness of breath.
To evaluate blood flow to the left arm and detect any vascular issues.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination of the upper extremities
Justification: To assess for any neurological deficits that may indicate a stroke or nerve injury.

Physical Exam: Blood pressure measurement in both arms
Justification: To compare blood pressure readings and assess for any significant differences that may indicate vascular issues.

Physical Exam: Assessment of range of motion in the left shoulder and arm
Justification: To evaluate for any limitations or pain during movement that may indicate musculoskeletal injury.
To rule out any referred pain from abdominal organs that may be contributing to the symptoms.
To monitor the patient's overall stability and detect any changes that may indicate deterioration.
